intro: Centaurea brevi-appendiculata, commonly known as the short-stalked centaurea, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with slender, branching stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are usually pink to red in color, with a distinctive central disk surrounded by petal-like bracts. Centaurea brevi-appendiculata is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open fields.
